content: quote: For the first time since Barack Obama took office, a major broadcast network is refusing to grant the president's request for primetime coverage. Fox has issued a statement saying it will air regular programming (detective drama Lie to Me) Wednesday night instead of Obama's 100-day news conference. "The Fox Broadcasting Company will not air the Presidential News Conference," Fox said in a statement. "Fox's sister networks, Fox News Channel and the Fox Business Network, will air the press conference in its entirety. Fox will be alerting viewers with an onscreen graphic at the top of the 8:00 PM (ET) hour that the press conference is available on Fox News Channel and the Fox Business Network." ABC, CBS and NBC have issued statements saying they will carry the president's telecast. (....) +http://www.thrfeed.com/2009/04/fox-rejects-obamas-request-for-airtime.html "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: It's only Tuesday but I'm calling this the NON-NEWS STORY of the week. Let's see, Fox Entertainment is not showing the press conference but will run an on screen message. "The Fox Broadcasting Company will not air the Presidential News Conference," Fox said in a statement. "Fox's sister networks, Fox News Channel and the Fox Business Network, will air the press conference in its entirety. Fox will be alerting viewers with an onscreen graphic at the top of the 8:00 PM (ET) hour that the press conference is available on Fox News Channel and the Fox Business Network." While on the topic of Fox News and Obama think back to the presidential primaries. Bill OReilly went through hell to get Obama to appear on The Factor. Eventually, Obama did appear on the show where Bill treated the man with the utmost respect. "So? I rejected Faux News years ago. No biggy." Wow CJ! This must be the first time TODAY you mentioned you don't like FOX NEWS. I began to suspect something in your last 1,367 Anti-Fox posts....

content: Not sure what the point of this Presidential Speech is anyways. Seems a bit ridiculous to be giving any kind of speech on the state of his administration after just 100 days... Lets get a question and answer session on why the credit markets are continuing to deteriorate, why unemployment continues to rise, why is an acting surgeon general, and acting CDC Director in charge of a possible new pandemic(going to appoint someone any time soon?) Oh yeah, and what impact did recklessly releasing the torture memos have on intelligence sharing with foreign nations who will not hand over information if it is carelessly thrown at the public...
reply: Not sure what the point of this Presidential Speech is anyways. Seems a bit ridiculous to be giving any kind of speech on the state of his administration after just 100 days... Lets get a question and answer session on why the credit markets are continuing to deteriorate, why unemployment continues to rise, why is an acting surgeon general, and acting CDC Director in charge of a possible new pandemic(going to appoint someone any time soon?) Oh yeah, and what impact did recklessly releasing the torture memos have on intelligence sharing with foreign nations who will not hand over information if it is carelessly thrown at the public...

content: This President has demanded more air time than any other in the history of the United States. I think I read that on Fox. But the poll did show he gets the majority of the PR. I said demanded cause that's what sells newspaper/TV. So we hadn't had our fill, last evening they did 10 minutes of his Misses (First lady) and her inspiration on a generation. How can anyone live up to this exposure for four years? Since JFK and camelot and the invention of TV, and then Al Gore inventing the internet, noone can stand the bright lights of Hollywood east. Americans are star struck.
reply: This President has demanded more air time than any other in the history of the United States. I think I read that on Fox. But the poll did show he gets the majority of the PR. content: quote: Originally posted by NSNN: quote: For the first time since Barack Obama took office, a major broadcast network is refusing to grant the president's request for primetime coverage. Fox has issued a statement saying it will air regular programming (detective drama Lie to Me) Wednesday night instead of Obama's 100-day news conference. "The Fox Broadcasting Company will not air the Presidential News Conference," Fox said in a statement. "Fox's sister networks, Fox News Channel and the Fox Business Network, will air the press conference in its entirety. Fox will be alerting viewers with an onscreen graphic at the top of the 8:00 PM (ET) hour that the press conference is available on Fox News Channel and the Fox Business Network." ABC, CBS and NBC have issued statements saying they will carry the president's telecast. (....) +http://www.thrfeed.com/2009/04/fox-rejects-obamas-request-for-airtime.html Maybe President Obama should stay at the whitehouse and actually do his job instead of letting Peolsi and Reid run the country. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin

content: It's only Tuesday but I'm calling this the NON-NEWS STORY of the week. Let's see, Fox Entertainment is not showing the press conference but will run an on screen message. "The Fox Broadcasting Company will not air the Presidential News Conference," Fox said in a statement. "Fox's sister networks, Fox News Channel and the Fox Business Network, will air the press conference in its entirety. Fox will be alerting viewers with an onscreen graphic at the top of the 8:00 PM (ET) hour that the press conference is available on Fox News Channel and the Fox Business Network." While on the topic of Fox News and Obama think back to the presidential primaries. Bill OReilly went through hell to get Obama to appear on The Factor. Eventually, Obama did appear on the show where Bill treated the man with the utmost respect. "So? I rejected Faux News years ago. No biggy." Wow CJ! This must be the first time TODAY you mentioned you don't like FOX NEWS. I began to suspect something in your last 1,367 Anti-Fox posts....

content: Not sure what the point of this Presidential Speech is anyways. Seems a bit ridiculous to be giving any kind of speech on the state of his administration after just 100 days... Lets get a question and answer session on why the credit markets are continuing to deteriorate, why unemployment continues to rise, why is an acting surgeon general, and acting CDC Director in charge of a possible new pandemic(going to appoint someone any time soon?) Oh yeah, and what impact did recklessly releasing the torture memos have on intelligence sharing with foreign nations who will not hand over information if it is carelessly thrown at the public...

content: This President has demanded more air time than any other in the history of the United States. I think I read that on Fox. But the poll did show he gets the majority of the PR. I said demanded cause that's what sells newspaper/TV. So we hadn't had our fill, last evening they did 10 minutes of his Misses (First lady) and her inspiration on a generation. How can anyone live up to this exposure for four years? Since JFK and camelot and the invention of TV, and then Al Gore inventing the internet, noone can stand the bright lights of Hollywood east. Americans are star struck.
